By Gracie Daw

By Gracie Daw

Renowned for its dirty-talking frankness and no holds barred sex-related debate, the third installment of Sexpose took place on Wednesday

The society's first application for ratification was denied almost two years ago

Candidates for 2015 YUSU elections revealed

There are five candidates running for YUSU President in this year's elections

Mansion bids to extend opening hours

The bid has been criticised by North Yorkshire Police and local councillors

ChemSoc members undergo hair-raising transformations for charity

Three of the society's members had their hair restyled for the Down's Syndrome Association

Disabled Staff Network launched

The Network was set up as part of a drive to make the University a more inclusive and "disability confident" environment for its employees

Anger over 'sarcastic' English feedback

Markers' comments were criticised for being illegible and vague

Application process for mitigating circumstances leads to further stress

One student was denied mitigating circumstances after failing to provide sufficient evidence of her father being in hospital

Survey finds 'impersonal' supervisors struggle to remember their students

The survey also suggested joint honour students would benefit more from the system if they had multiple supervisors to represent all of their subjects

Students level competition at YUSU with new club night

The night will be held at Mansion and is called 'Gasoline'

Constantine and Derwent launch motto competitions

Halifax and James have also revealed the creation of a college motto is under consideration

Societies warned over complaints about room usage

Eighteen warnings have been issued to societies about the state rooms were left in

Closure of campus bookstore confirmed

The University called the shop's closure a 'matter of regret'

York TheatreGoers help raise funds for redevelopment of local theatre

If the society reaches their fundraising target, they will have a seat named after it

Maguire pushes for Heslington East developments after council rejects plans

The proposed developments included the construction of a new supermarket and health centre

York Labour Club event cancelled amid security fears

The event would have involved a talk from a Labour Party activist about the Israel-Palestine conflict

Breathalysers introduced in nine York venues

The devices have been introduced to help combat drink-related problems in the city

University awards four new honorary doctorates

A playwright and chemist are amongst the four people who have been honoured by the University

Protesters remember Pakistani lives in night time campus vigil

The vigil took place at Vanbrugh Paradise on Friday evening

York film makes into Huffington Post top ten

The Knife That Killed Me was described by the website as 'wonderfully inventive'

Report shows rise in graduate prospects

The number of graduates hired by employers in The Times Top 100 rose by 7.9 per cent

Thanks, but no thanks

A recent NUS survey found that a quarter of respondents had experienced unwanted sexual advances. Tess Pullen examines how the issue affects students at the University of York.

University to launch app to improve on-campus security

The app is called SafeZone and will be available later this week

York academic awarded OBE in New Year Honours List

Professor Robin Millar has been recognised for his contribution to Science Education

Former York academic admits to sharing indecent images of children

Dr Allan Richard Hall was a member of the Department of Archaeology for over 30 years

Report suggests graduate salaries linked to university and subject choice

The average starting salary of graduates from universities in the Sutton Trust 13, including the University of York, is 17 per cent higher than graduates from post-1992 universities

University of York recognised for excellence in research

The University was ranked 14th overall out of 155 higher education institutions

Graduate Students' Association election results announced

Two Student Trustees and ten Council Members were elected alongside a Vice-President (Postgraduate Student Activities) and Vice-President (Postgraduate Community)

New Chancellor appointed by University

Professor Sir Malcolm Grant will take over the position from 1 August

A close look at the college system

Sam Maguire, YUSU President, explores ways in which the college system could be developed to ensure students get the most of it
